UC1.name: UAV Canyelles Vineyard Dataset 2023-06-09
UC1.author: Esther Vera, Oriol Arroyo, Aldo Sollazzo, Chirag Rangholia, Paula Osés
UC1.description: Crop monitoring dataset generated with DJI Mavic 3M UAV and Metashape Agisoft that contains vineyard images and RGB and multispectral pointcloud data, orthomosaic images and the DEM. This data is aligned with the rest of UAV Canyelles Vineyard Datasets uploaded by Noumena (UC1), so different orthomosaics / pointclouds / DEM of different dates can be analyzed jointly for cropped and uncropped files.

parameters.contents: RGB images, shapefile, pointclouds, orthomosaics, DEM.

UC1.name: UC1 DATA FOLDER GITHUB

parameters.contents: Features files with rows and plants positions for orthomosaic, health status, images for UC1 models and images generated.

UC1.name: VINEYARD PLANTS LABELLED FOR DETECTION (HEALTHY, MILDEW, LOW-IRON)
UC1.author: Esther Vera, Aldo Sollazzo, Chirag Rangholia
UC1.description: This dataset consists of 508 images labeled for detecting plant health in vineyards. Each image is annotated with bounding boxes and has a resolution of 640 × 640 pixels. The dataset is formatted for YOLOv12 and was manually labeled using Roboflow. It is divided into 356 images for training, 102 images for validation, and 50 images for testing, ensuring a balanced distribution for model development and evaluation.

parameters.contents: 508 labeled images of vineyard plant health: Healthy, Mildew, and Low-Iron Deficiency, for YOLOv12.

UC3.name: Drone raw images of cattle in french grazing areas
UC3.author: Adrien Lebreton
UC3.description: The dataset encompasses around 900 raw .jpeg drone images of grazing areas where cattle graze collected between June and August 2023.

parameters.contents: Drone images, flight metadata

UC3.name: Sheep videos taken from drone at low altitude
UC3.author: Adrien Lebreton, Louise Helary
UC3.description: The dataset encompasses 16 .MP4 videos from drone (DJI mavic 3 Enterprise or Thermal) of around 50 sheep crossing a gate.

parameters.contents: Drone videos

UC3.name: Drone images and their annotations of grazing cows
UC3.author: Adrien Lebreton, Louise Helary
UC3.description: It contains 1385 images and 4941 bounding boxes of cows taken with a DJI Pilot 2 drone. This dataset is a major contribution for public and research stakeholders to develop cow detection and counting models.

parameters.contents: Drone images, flight metadata, bounding boxes annotations

UC3.name: Drone videos and their annotations of passing sheep (for counting purpose)
UC3.author: Louise Helary, Kinsey Nnenna, Marta Kolodziejczyk, Jana Schewe, Léa Philip, Estelle Nicolas, Adrien Lebreton
UC3.description: The dataset encompasses 4 .MP4 videos from drone (DJI mavic 3 Enterprise or Thermal) of around 50 sheep crossing a gate.

parameters.contents: Drone videos, flight metadata, annotations in YOLO and MOTS

UC3.name: Aerial videos and images of goats (for computer vision purpose)
UC3.author: Adrien Lebreton, Laurence Depuille, Estelle Nicolas, Louise Helary
UC3.description: The dataset contains drone-captured videos and images from two goat farms in France, featuring varied settings and resolutions.

parameters.contents: Drone videos, RGB images

UC3.name: Drone images and their annotations of goats/small ruminants (for computer vision purpose)
UC3.author: Adrien Lebreton, Léane Duval, Laurence Depuille, Estelle Nicolas, Louise Helary
UC3.description: This dataset includes annotated drone videos and images of sheep and goats with YOLO-labeled bounding boxes for computer vision detection.

parameters.contents: Drone images, flight metadata, YOLO annotations

UC3.name: Drone videos and images of sheep in various conditions (for computer vision purpose)
UC3.author: Adrien Lebreton, Coline Morin, Estelle Nicolas, Louise Helary
UC3.description: Counting sheep and goats is a significant challenge for farmers managing flocks with hundreds of animals. Our objective is to develop a computer vision-based methodology to count sheep and goats as they pass through a corridor or gate. This approach utilizes low-altitude aerial videos (<15 m) recorded by drones.

parameters.location: Alpes de Haute Provence and Limousin, France
parameters.contents: Drone videos, RGB images

OCT - SHIELD.author: Obsidian Innovation Institute - Associação

parameters.contents: NMEA sentences

OCT - DAEPHC.name: Datasets from hop field 3 (orthomosaic of RGB, multispectral band and thermal sensor) from July 5 2024
OCT - DAEPHC.author: Matej Knapic
OCT - DAEPHC.description: The upload consists of 2 zip files. First one has orthomosaic of RGB, 4 multispectral bands and the second one the orhomosaic of thermal dataand RGB  prepared in PIX4D mapper software. The images were taken from 40 m height. The images are normalized with white reference plate. The thermal images were converted before mosaicing from sensor units to °C with DJI Image Processor Version v1.6.2 developed by Miro Rava. All data are in Slovenian coordinate system EPSG=3794.

parameters.contents: RGB orthomosaics, multispectral orthomosaics, thermal data

OCT - DAEPHC.name: Datasets from hop field 2 (orthomosaic of RGB, multispectral band and thermal sensor) from July 9 2024
OCT - DAEPHC.author: Matej Knapic
OCT - DAEPHC.description: The upload consists of 2 zip files. First one has orthomosaic of RGB, 4 multispectral bands and the second one the orhomosaic of thermal dataand RGB  prepared in PIX4D mapper software. The images were taken from 40 m height. The images are normalized with white reference plate. The thermal images were converted before mosaicing from sensor units to °C with DJI Image Processor Version v1.6.2 developed by Miro Rava. All data are in Slovenian coordinate system EPSG=3794.

parameters.contents: RGB orthomosaics, multispectral orthomosaics, thermal data

OCT - DAEPHC.name: Datasets from hop field 1 (orthomosaic of RGB, multispectral band and thermal sensor) from June 28  2024
OCT - DAEPHC.author: Matej Knapic
OCT - DAEPHC.description: The upload consists of 2 zip files. First one has orthomosaic of RGB, 4 multispectral bands and the second one the orhomosaic of thermal dataand RGB  prepared in PIX4D mapper software. The images were taken from 40 m height. The images are normalized with white reference plate. The thermal images were converted before mosaicing from sensor units to °C with DJI Image Processor Version v1.6.2 developed by Miro Rava. All data are in Slovenian coordinate system EPSG=3794.

parameters.contents: RGB orthomosaics, multispectral orthomosaics, thermal data

OCT - LowAltitude.author: Chris Crane
OCT - LowAltitude.description: A dataset of multipectral images and drone flight logs.

OCT - LowAltitude.description: Lidar files for a full vineyard, that can be used to create a 3d model.

OCT - LowAltitude.author: Chris Crane

OCT - LowAltitude.name: PDF reports showing outcome of multispectral survey of Vineyard
OCT - LowAltitude.author: Chris Crane
OCT - LowAltitude.description: The pdf output reports generated in Pix4dFields of each multispectral vineyard surveys conducted.

OCT - InnovPlantProtect.name: Raw DJI Mavic 3M RTK RGB and Multispectral drone imagery collected on 2024-05-28
OCT - InnovPlantProtect.author: iLaria Marengo, Nuno Faria
OCT - InnovPlantProtect.description: High-resolution RGB and multispectral drone imagery of six Alentejo vineyards, collected in 2024 and georeferenced manually.

parameters.contents: RGB images, multispectral images, flight metadata

OCT - InnovPlantProtect.name: RGB and Multispectral orthomosaics obtained by processing raw imagery (dated 20240528) in webODM software
OCT - InnovPlantProtect.author: iLaria Marengo, Nuno Faria
OCT - InnovPlantProtect.description: RGB and multispectral orthomosaics of six Alentejo vineyards, processed with webODM for stress and productivity analysis.

parameters.contents: RGB orthomosaics, multispectral orthomosaics, 3D pointclouds, DEM, drone flight logs

OCT - InnovPlantProtect.name: Input and output datasets for training the AI-based vine segmentation model (YOLOv9)
OCT - InnovPlantProtect.author: iLaria Marengo, Nuno Faria
OCT - InnovPlantProtect.description: It contains RGB orthomosaics and 5x5 m vector cells as inputs, with YOLOv9 segmentation outputs including vine polygons and vegetation index rasters.

parameters.contents: RGB orthomosaics, segmented vines, shapefiles, vegetetation indices (NDVI, GNDVI, NDRE)

OCT - Veles Sense.name: DiVine project - Veles Sense
OCT - Veles Sense.author: Veles Sense
OCT - Veles Sense.description: Vineyards maps to distinguish disease from nutritional deficiencies. Includes orthomosaics, ground truth, sampling, vine extraction and vegetation indices.

parameters.contents: Orthomosaics, ground truth, sampling data, vine extraction results, vegetation indices

OCT - Institute for Security and Strateg.name: IDSSF: Illegal logging usecase - DJI Zenmuse L2 lidar dataset
OCT - Institute for Security and Strateg.author: Institute for Security and Strategic Research
OCT - Institute for Security and Strateg.description: This dataset contains two classified point clouds (ground and non-ground) of a forest affected by illegal logging, one taken before and one after the logging.

parameters.contents: Pointclouds

OCT - gprSense.name: Example Soil Moisture Maps
OCT - gprSense.author: gprSense
OCT - gprSense.description: The dataset features gprSense drone-borne GPR maps demonstrating root-zone soil moisture mapping capability.

parameters.contents: Soil moisture maps, radar data, QGIS project files

OCT - European Center for Training and R.name: U-AInSPECT Project: Bridge Use Case dataset
OCT - European Center for Training and R.author: Institute for Security and Strategic Research
OCT - European Center for Training and R.description: The dataset provides UAS and AI-based bridge inspection data, including imagery, damage detection, and 3D reconstruction for structural monitoring research.

parameters.contents: Videos, images, damage detection outputs, 3D reconstruction, bridge data

UARSF.name: Data on three-year flowering intensity monitoring in an apple orchard: A collection of RGB images acquired from unmanned aerial vehicles
UARSF.author: Chenglong Zhang, João Valente, Wensheng Wang, Pieter van Dalfsen, Peter Frans de Jong, Bert Rijk, Lammert Kooistra
UARSF.description: The dataset contains UAV images captured during the full blooming period in an apple orchard over three consecutive years (2018-2020). It is linked to research on quantifying flower intensity using UAV RGB imagery. This data can be utilized in the fields of remote sensing, machine vision, deep learning, and precision horticulture for flowering intensity estimation and prediction.

parameters.contents: Geotagged UAV images, flower cluster counts, floridity ground truth

UARSF.name: Dataset on UAV RGB videos acquired over a vineyard including bunch labels for object detection and tracking
UARSF.author: Mar Ariza-Sentís, Sergio Vélez, João Valente
UARSF.description: This dataset contains 40 RGB videos of a vineyard in northern Spain, acquired via UAV for object detection and tracking of grape bunches. The dataset is designed to facilitate grape bunch counting and assist winegrowers in assessing vineyard health. It includes mask labels of visible grape bunches, recorded throughout four UAV flights with the camera tilted at 60 degrees.

parameters.contents: RGB videos, grape annotations

UARSF.name: Dataset on unmanned aerial vehicle multispectral images acquired over a vineyard affected by Botrytis cinerea in northern Spain
UARSF.author: Sergio Vélez, Mar Ariza-Sentís, João Valente
UARSF.description: This dataset contains 16504 multispectral images acquired via UAV over a 1.06 ha vineyard in northern Spain affected by Botrytis cinerea. The images were taken during four flights at 30 m height with varying camera tilt angles (0°, 30°, 45°, and 0° in the afternoon to capture plant shadows). The dataset supports research in disease detection, 3D reconstruction, and orthomosaic generation in vineyards.

parameters.contents: Multispectral images, orthomosaics, vegetation indices

UARSF.name: Dataset on UAV High-resolution Images from Grassland with Broad-leaved Dock (Rumex Obtusifolius)
UARSF.author: João Valente, Lammert Kooistra
UARSF.description: The dataset contains orthophotos constructed from UAV images of a grassland field in Kleve, Germany, where several Rumex obtusifolius plants were detected. The images were captured at 10, 15, and 30 meters height, and labels/annotations of the plants are provided.

parameters.contents: Orthophotos, labels of Rumex obtusifolius plants

UARSF.name: Diurnal UAV-based sun-induced chlorophyll fluorescence over potato and sugar beet fields
UARSF.author: Na Wang, Juha Suomalainen, Harm Bartholomeus, Lammert Kooistra, Dainius Masiliunas, Jan Clevers
UARSF.description: This dataset contains UAV-based sun-induced chlorophyll fluorescence data acquired over potato and sugar beet fields on August 2, 2018, during clear sky conditions. Four flights were conducted following a diurnal cycle at 9:45, 11:38, 14:15, and 16:28. Multispectral measurements were collected around 11:00 using a Parrot Sequoia+ sensor.

parameters.location: Wageningen University and Research farm, the Netherlands
parameters.contents: Sun-induced chlorophyll fluorescence data, multispectral data, shapefile.

UARSF.name: Haus Riswick grassland experiment with N fertilization and plant growth monitoring based on Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) hyperspectral imagery - campaigns of 2014 and 2017
UARSF.author: Lammert Kooistra, Marston H D Franceschini, Rolf Becker, Florian Wichern, J.M. (Juha) Suomalainen, Harm Bartholomeus, Alessandra Capolupo
UARSF.description: This dataset contains UAV hyperspectral imagery and field measurements of dry aboveground biomass, nitrogen content (N%), and nitrogen uptake from experimental grassland plots near Kleve, Germany. Data were collected during five campaigns on two dates in 2014 and three dates in 2017. The UAV flights used the WageningenUR Hyperspectral Mapping System (HYMSY) with a pushbroom imaging sensor and a photogrammetric camera.

parameters.contents: Hyperspectral images, dry biomass, nitrogen measures, ground truth plant growth data.

UARSF.name: UAV-based Multispectral & Thermal dataset for exploring the diurnal variability, radiometric & geometric accuracy for precision agriculture
UARSF.author: Christina Kallimani, Ramin Heidarian, Frits K. van Evert, Bert Rijk, Lammert Kooistra
UARSF.description: This dataset explores diurnal variability, radiometric and geometric accuracy in UAV-based multispectral and thermal imagery for precision agriculture. The data were collected in a one-day field campaign on 21 June 2017 over wheat, barley, and potato fields at Wageningen University and Research (WUR) farm. The dataset includes imagery from various sensors and validation measurements from radiometric calibration plates and plant sample locations.

parameters.location: Wageningen University and Research farm, the Netherlands
parameters.contents: Multispectral images, thermal images, orthomosaics, radiometric calibration, plant sample validation.

UARSF.name: Speulderbos Terrestrial (TLS) and Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Laser Scanning (UAV-LS) 2017
UARSF.author: Benjamin Brede, A.I. (Alvaro) Lau Sarmiento, Pasi Raumonen, Harm Bartholomeus, Martin Herold, Lammert Kooistra
UARSF.description: This dataset contains TLS and UAV-LS point clouds from the 2017 Speulderbos Laser Scanning campaign. It covers approximately 2 hectares of forest, including 1 hectare of mature beech and oak trees and 1 hectare of mixed species. The data was acquired during early May 2017, when around half of the deciduous trees had no leaves. It provides valuable information for studying above-ground plant biomass and forest inventory.

parameters.contents: TLS pointclouds, forest inventory data, LAZ, shapefiles

WU.name: RGB-to-NDVI-conversion dataset
WU.author: Jurrian Doornbos
WU.description: Dataset for the article: Evaluating Generalization of Methods for Artificially Generating NDVI from UAV RGB Imagery in Vineyards

parameters.contents: RGB chip images, NDVI chip images, orthomosaics, CHM, DEM, DSM.

WU.name: msuav500k: Foundational Dataset for Multispectral and RGB UAV Imagery
WU.author: Jurrian Doornbos
WU.description: The msuav500k dataset is a comprehensive collection of 598,300 curated UAV images designed for computer vision and remote sensing applications. This foundational dataset addresses critical interoperability challenges in UAV-based multispectral imaging by providing standardized, radiometrically calibrated imagery from multiple sensor platforms.

parameters.contents: RGB images, Multispectral images

Online.name: UFRGS_UAV
Online.author: Ricardo S. Westhauser
Online.description: This dataset contains five sets (each set from a different spectra) of images taken by an UAV equipped with a downward looking multispectral camera (Parrot Sequoia), in one flight. The region in which the UAV flyed was Porto Alegre (more specifically, Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul, Campus do Vale), a city from Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil. In addition to the sets of images, there are also a folder with twelve satellite images from Porto Alegre, a README file, a .kml and a .DAT file.

parameters.location: Porto Alegre, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil
parameters.contents: UAV multispectral images, satellite images, .kml files, .DAT files

Online.name: Gummern - Mining Waste Deposits Multispectral UAV Imagery
Online.author: Enoc Sanz Albeno
Online.description: Mining Waste Deposits Multispectral UAV Imagery from DJI Mavic 3M

parameters.contents: Multispectral images

Online.name: Hullerbusch beech forest, Germany, captured by UAV-based multispectral imaging
Online.author: Robert Jackisch
Online.description: This data set contains data products of a multispectral UAV survey over the Hullerbusch beach forest, located in southern Mecklenburg–Western Pomerania, Germany. As survey drone, the DJI M300 with RTK antenna was employed and the multispectral image data was captured with a Micasense Altum multispectral camera. Data were processed in Agisoft Metashape 1.7, with the orthomosaic converted to reflectance.

parameters.contents: Orthomosaics, DSM, RGB pointcloud, shapefile, Agisoft processing report

Online.name: Cherry Tree Disease Detection Dataset
Online.author: Christos Chaschatzis, Ilias Siniosoglou, Anna Triantafyllou, Chrysoula Karaiskou, Athanasios Liatifis, Panagiotis Radoglou-Grammatikis, Dimitrios Pliatsios, Vasiliki Kelli, Thomas Lagkas, Vasileios Argyriou, Panagiotis Sarigiannidis
Online.description: This cherry tree disease detection dataset is a multimodal, multi-angle dataset which was constructed for monitoring the growth of cherry trees, including stress analysis and prediction. An orchard of cherry trees is considered in the area of Western Macedonia, where 577 cherry trees were recorded in a full crop season starting from Jul. 2021 to Jul. 2022. The dataset includes a) aerial / Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) images, b) ground RGB images/photos, and c) ground multispectral images/photos. Two agronomist experts annotated the dataset by identifying a stress, which in this case is a common disease in cherry trees known as Armillaria [1][2].

parameters.contents: RGB images, multispectral images, disease annotations.

Online.name: FlexiGroBots - Blueberry orchard UAV dataset
Online.author: Ivošević Bojana, Grbović Željana, Stefanović Dimitrije, Filipović Vladan, Antić Aleksandar, Pajević Nina, Marko Oskar, Panić Marko
Online.description: Dataset consists of UAV drone images: 6 channels: reflectance blue, reflectance green, reflectance red, reflectance red edge, reflectance NIR, RGB. In order to align different channels, registration was applied and because of uneven illumination during the acquisition process, illumination correction was performed. Thus, the results of each preprocessing step are located in separate folders, i.e. raw data are in 100FPLAN and 101FPLAN, results of registration are in 100FPLAN_registrated and 101FPLAN_registrated, while images with corrected illumination are in 100FPLAN_registrated_corrected and 101FPLAN_registrated_corrected. Orthomosaics created before and after preprocessing are located in UAV orthomosaics folder.

parameters.contents: RGB images, multispectral images (B, G, R, RE, NIR), orthomosaics

Online.name: mDRONES4rivers-project: UAV-imagery of the project area Nonnenwerth at the Rhine River, Germany
Online.author: Gilles Rock, Tina Mölter, Paul Deffert, Filip Dzunic, Laura Giese, Edvinas Rommel, Frederik Kathoefer
Online.description: Spatially and temporally high-resolution data was acquired with the aid of multispectral sensors mounted on UAV and a gyrocopter platform for the purpose of classification. The work was part of the research and development project „Modern sensors and airborne remote sensing for the mapping of vegetation and hydromorphology along Federal waterways in Germany

Online.name: Multispectral imaging dataset of potato plants on the field, acquired using UAV
Online.author: Janez Lapajne, Andrej Vončina, Ana Vojnović
Online.description: Multispectral images of potato field crops were captured using a SKYHERO SPYDER X4-850 GEO Edition Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) with a Micasense Rededge MX 5-band multispectral camera.

parameters.contents: Multispectral orthophotos, shapefiles, ground physiological measurements, disease scoring, metadata

Online.name: Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) data acquired over a subtropical forest area of the UFSM campus Frederico Westphalen, on October 22, 2020, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil
Online.author: Fabio Marcelo Breunig, Eduardo Rieder, Renato Souza Santos
Online.description: The data were acquired from an aerial survey conducted with an Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV, also Drone) covering a forest area of the Federal University of Santa Maria – UFSM in the municipality of Frederico Westphalen, in the Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil. The climate of the region is subtropical (Cfa in the Köppen-Geiger classification) with an average annual temperature of 18 °C and annual precipitation of 1919 mm. The rainfall is well distributed throughout the year.

parameters.location: Frederico Westphalen, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil
parameters.contents: Multispectral images, RGB images, orthomosaics, DEM.

Online.name: A dataset of unmanned aerial vehicle multispectral images acquired over a field to identify nitrogen requirements
Online.author: C.L.I.S. Fonseka, Thilina Halloluwa, K.P. Hewagamage, Upul Rathnayake, R.M.U. S Bandara
Online.description: The technique of detecting and tracking an area's physical properties from a distance by measuring its reflected and emitted radiation is known as remote sensing. It gathered data accurately in near real-time. For this purpose, multispectral cameras mounted on UAVs that capture images with different bands can be used to generate vegetation indexes (NDVI, NDRE), which are useful in precision agriculture. In this study UAV image dataset contains 336 multispectral images from a 0.06 ha paddy field with three different phonological cycles of the crop (vegetative, reproductive, and ripening) in the north-western province of Sri Lanka. The selected sample rice variety is BG300. The images were taken over five days, starting from August 14 to October 5, 2023.

parameters.contents: Multispectral images (G, R, RE, NIR), RGB images, SPAD meter readings, shapefiles.

Online.name: High resolution image dataset by RGB and multispectral cameras on an unmanned aerial vehicle over a secondary tropical dry forest
Online.author: Masuly Vega-Puga, Jaime Garatuza-Payán, Miguel A. Rivera-Diaz, Onésimo Galaz, Juan C. Alvarez-Yépiz, Enrico A. Yepéz
Online.description: Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAV) are advantageous to assess vegetation and terrain changes at a high spatial resolution, advancing our understanding of shifts in ecosystem states and processes. The extension of land that we sought to observe belongs to the footprint of an Eddy Covariance System (around 7.5 ha), installed in a secondary ecological succession of the tropical dry forest within the Sierra de Álamos-Rio Cuchujaqui natural protected area, Sonora, Mexico. Aerial images were obtained with a system of multispectral and RGB cameras mounted on a UAV, which executed automated missions in two different seasons: 1) dry season (June 2023) and 2) first rain season (July 2023), totalling 1116 images.

parameters.location: El Area Natural Protegida Sierra de Alamos-Rio Cuchujaqui, Sonora, Mexico
parameters.contents: RGB images, multispectral images (B, G, R, RE, NIR), orthomosaics, metadata

Online.name: Orthophotos and DSMs/DTM derived from RPAS flights over the nature reserve Landschap De Liereman in Flanders, Belgium
Online.author: Jeroen Vanden Borre, Pauly Klaas, Stijn Van Hoey, Jeroen De Reu, Peter Desmet
Online.description: Landschap De Liereman is a nature reserve situated in Oud-Turnhout, in the province of Antwerp, Flanders, Belgium. The area is managed by the nature conservation NGO Natuurpunt and consists of a diverse landscape of wet and dry heathlands, Nardus grasslands on siliceous soils, forests and transition mires, as well as some remaining arable fields and high-intensity agricultural grasslands.

parameters.contents: RGB orthophotos, multispectral orthophotos, DSM, DTM, flight metadata

Online.name: UAS-SfM data from Unoccupied aerial system (UAS) Structure-from-Motion canopy fuel parameters: Multisite area-based modelling across forests in California, USA
Online.author: Sean Reilly, Matthew L. Clark, Lika Loechler, Jack Spillane, Melina Kozanitas, Paris Krause, David Ackerly, Lisa Patrick Bentley, Imma Oliveras Menor
Online.description: Unoccupied aerial system (UAS) Structure-from-Motion canopy fuel parameters: Multisite area-based modelling across forests in California, USA

parameters.contents: Multispectral UAS-SfM data

Online.name: Multispectral imagery of macroalgae in Illas Cíes (NW Spain)
Online.author: Andrea Martinez-Movilla, Marta Román-Geada, Juan Luis Rodríguez Somoza, Celia Olabarria, Joaquín Martínez-Sánchez
Online.description: This dataset focuses on an intertidal coastal environment in Illas Cíes, NW Spain. It includes multispectral orthoimages (5 bands), photoquadrat images, and manually segmented shapefiles. The dataset spans 4 months and contains 20 orthoimages (5 per month, one for each band: Blue, Green, Red, Red edge, and NIR). There are also 164 photoquadrat images and 8 shapefiles with a total of 949 polygons. The dataset classifies the intertidal area into 9 categories: Codium spp., Ulva spp., C. peregrina, B. bifurcata, E. selaginoides, S. polyschides, S. muticum, Inert and water.

parameters.contents: Multispectral orthoimages (B, G, R, RE, NIR), photoquadrat images, shapefiles.

Online.name: Data for estimating spruce tree health using drone-based RGB and multispectral imagery
Online.author: Samuli Junttila, Roope Näsi, Niko Koivumäki, Mohammad Imangholiloo, Ninni Saarinen, Juha Raisio, Markus Holopainen, Hannu Hyyppä, Juha Hyyppä, Päivi Lyytikäinen-Saarenmaa, Mikko Vastaranta, Eija Honkavaara
Online.description: The dataset contains multispectral and RGB orthomosaics (.tif), and photogrammetric point clouds (.laz) of four study areas (about 25 ha each), where bark beetle-related decline of Norway spruce has been observed in Helsinki, Finland. The filenames refer to Area 1 (Männikkötie), Area 2 (Maunulanmaja), Area 3 (Hakuninmaa), and Area 4 (Paloheinä), described in detail in Junttila et al. 2022.

parameters.contents: Multispectral orthomosaics, RGB orthomosaics, pointclouds, geolocated tree crown polygons.

Online.name: Post-remediation evaluation of contaminated site using geophysical methods: Multispectral UAV data Olkusz (Poland) 20220629
Online.author: Marta Kondracka
Online.description: In order to analyze the vegetation condition, photos were taken in the infrared (NIR, 750 - 2500 nm) and infrared (Red Edge, 690-720 nm) range. The DJI Matrice 600 platform was used for the raid. The photos were taken from the ceiling of 150 m with the MicaSense Red Edge M camera with a focal length of 6 mm.

parameters.contents: Multispectral images (RE, NIR).

Online.name: Annotated image dataset with different stages of European pear rust for UAV-based automated symptom detection in orchards
Online.author: Maß, Virginia; Alirezazadeh, Pendar; Seidl-Schulz, Johannes; Leipnitz, Matthias; Fritzsche, Eric; Ibraheem, Rasheed Ali Adam; Geyer, Martin; Pflanz, Michael; Reim, Stefanie
Online.description: RGB drone imagery dataset for pear rust detection and analysis captured using DJI Phantom 4 Pro/Matrice 300 RTK at 0.7m altitude.

parameters.contents: RGB images with 3-channel data, 0.2-0.07m resolution, CHIP format.

Online.name: CoFly-WeedDB: A UAV image dataset for weed detection and species identificationn
Online.author: Marios Krestenitis, Emmanuel K. Raptis, Athanasios Ch. Kapoutsis, Konstantinos Ioannidis, Elias B. Kosmatopoulos, Stefanos Vrochidis, Ioannis Kompatsiaris
Online.description: RGB drone imagery dataset for cotton weed detection and species identification captured using DJI Phantom 4 Pro at 1.2m altitude.

parameters.contents: RGB images with 3-channel data, CHIP format.

Online.name: An instance segmentation dataset of cabbages over the whole growing season for UAV imagery
Online.author: Yui Yokoyama, Tsutomu Matsui, Takashi S.T. Tanaka
Online.description: RGB drone imagery dataset for cabbage detection during growing season captured using DJI Matrice 300 RTK at 0.7m altitude.

parameters.contents: RGB images with 3-channel data, CHIP format.

Online.name: MH-SoyaHealthVision: An Indian UAV and Leaf Image Dataset for Integrated Crop Health Assessment
Online.author: Sayali Shinde, Dr.Vahida Attar
Online.description: Currently, the farming sector is transitioning towards Agriculture 5.0, also known as digital farming. This approach utilizes data-driven technologies, such as artificial intelligence and computer vision, to transform the agriculture sector. These technologies enable the automation of several farming tasks. To develop accurate and robust machine learning/deep learning models high quality datasets are needed. With this aim, we have created a comprehensive dataset of soybean crop images affected by diseases and pest attacks from original fields of Maharashtra region located in India. Data acquisition was conducted across two seasons through aerial as well as ground-based approaches. The dataset is enriched with 4 types of diseases and 1 pest attack. The proposed dataset will serve as a valuable resource for training and testing machine learning and deep learning models ,enabling accurate detection and classification of diseases and pests attack damage.

parameters.contents: RGB images with 3-channel data, 4m altitude, RAW format.

Online.name: OliveTreeCrownsDb, Detection and Segmentation in Agricultural Computer Vision
Online.description: OliveTreeCrownsDb, a comprehensive dataset of high-resolution images captured by a DJI Phantom 4 RTK drone. The dataset includes 46 images covering an entire olive farm, focusing on the detection and analysis of olive tree crowns and supporting segmentation tasks. Each image is accompanied by detailed metadata, such as focal distance, capture altitude, GPS coordinates, and other essential parameters for accurate tree mapping and localization. OliveTreeCrownsDb is publicly accessible, promoting research in precision agriculture, including tree crown detection, segmentation, geometric shape analysis, automation, yield estimation, and computer vision applications.

parameters.contents: RGB images with 3-channel data, 2m altitude, RAW format.

Online.name: UAV-PDD2023: A benchmark dataset for pavement distress detection based on UAV images
Online.author: Haohui Yan, Junfei Zhang
Online.description: The UAV-PDD2023 dataset, captured by unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs), provides a benchmark for road damage detection. It is highly useful for municipal authorities and road agencies to conduct low-cost road condition monitoring.

parameters.contents: RGB images with 3-channel data, 2m altitude, CHIP format.

Online.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) images of road vehicles dataset
Online.author: Nama Ezzaalddin Mustafa, Fattah Alizadeh
Online.description: This annotated dataset contains five different types of vehicles: cars, taxis, trucks, buses, and motorcycles taken from Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs), which we commonly know as drones. Mavic Air 2 Drone was used to take all the pictures in the Iraqi cities of Sulaimaniyah and Erbil.

parameters.contents: RGB images with 3-channel data, 0.3m altitude, RAW format.

Online.name: Avo-AirDB: An avocado UAV Database for agricultural image segmentation and classification
Online.author: Khalid EL Amraoui, Mouataz Lghoul, Ayoub Ezzaki, Lhoussaine Masmoudi, Majid Hadri, Hicham Elbelrhiti, Aziz Abdou Simo
Online.description: Avo-AirDB represents a database of an avocado field located in Morocco. it contains 986 high-resolution RGB aerial images, as well as 93 annotated images in two different ways. the data is dedicated to researchers in the digital agricultural domain. it can be used to develop machine learning algorithms.

parameters.contents: RGB images with 3-channel data, 8m altitude, CHIP format, 2.7m resolution.

Online.name: UAV-Images dataset over a small intertidal coastal strip within El Soldado, estuary in Guaymas, Sonora, México.
Online.author: Miguel Sebastián Encinas Lara, Luis Arturo Mendez Barroso
Online.description: This dataset contains 314 aerial photographs taken in March 02, 2019 at 9 a.m. (UTC - 07:00) over an experimental site instrumented with an eddy covariance tower and meteorological sensors at El Soldado estuary located at the South-eastern margin of the Gulf of California

parameters.contents: RGB images with 3-channel data, 1.4m altitude, RAW format.

Online.name: Dataset of thermal and visible aerial images for multi-modal and multi-spectral image registration and fusion
Online.author: Lina M. García-Moreno, Jean P. Díaz-Paz, Humberto Loaiza-Correa, Andrés D. Restrepo-Girón
Online.description: This dataset presents thermal and visible aerial images of a flat scene with their respective geospatial data, a visible georeferenced orthoimage and the homography matrices between the images and the orthoimage, which are useful for other researchers to assess and develop new techniques for improvement, registration and fusion of thermal and visible images.

parameters.contents: RGB images with 3-channel data, 0.15m altitude, ORTHO format.

Online.name: Mine 4.0-mineCareerDB: A high-resolution image dataset for mining career segmentation and object detection
Online.author: Nasreddine Haqiq, Mounia Zaim, Mohamed Sbihi, Khalid El Amraoui, Mustapha El Alaoui, Lhoussaine Masmoudi, Hamza Echarrafi
Online.description: Mine 4.0-MineCareerDB, a publicly available dataset of high-resolution image captured by a DJI Phantom 4 RTK drone specifically designed for analyzing mining careers. The dataset comprises a collection of 373 images depicting various mining operations and activities. Each image is georeferenced and offers a detailed view of mining activities, including the use of various equipment, infrastructure, and overall mining environment.

parameters.contents: RGB images with 3-channel data, 4m altitude, CHIP format.
